Text:
Shit, wrong description. Here's the right one:

Covenant live in Moscow 2010-12-04 
Synthetic Snow Festival VIII @ Tochka club, Moscow, Russia 
16:9 PAL DVD5 

Video: 16:9 PAL 5100kbps (reencoded from original 1080p HD video footage) 
Audio: 48kHz 16bit 2ch PCM 
DVD: menu for song selection, one chapter per song 

Source: recorded from the audience and converted to DVD format by parafin (AKA parafin@paraf.in) 

Used hardware: 
Canon EOS 7D with Canon EF 35mm f/2 lens - video recording 
Zoom H4n - audio recording 

Used software: 
Audacity 1.3.9 - audio equalization and normalization 
Avidemux 2.5.1_p5428 - occasional video cutting 
SoX 14.3.0 - audio cutting and format conversion 
MPlayer 1.0_rc4_p20110322 - video decoding 
FFmpeg 0.7.4 - video encoding 
Inkscape 0.48.2 - menu background drawing 
GIMP 2.6.11 - menu designing 
DVDAuthor 0.6.14 and mjpegtools 2.0.0 - DVD authoring 

Duration: 1h 17m 

Setlist: 
01. Stalker 
02. 20 Hz 
03. Dynamo Clock 
04. We Stand Alone 
05. I Am 
06. The Beauty And The Grace 
07. Brave New World 
08. The Men 
09. Ritual Noise 
10. Der Leiermann 
11. Lightbringer 
12. Call The Ships To Port 
Encore 
13. Dead Stars 

Beginning of the first song is missing, sorry about that. 

Bonus: 
A small (1m 54s) snippet of Architect (Daniel Myer's project) live on the same stage earlier that night plus 2 other bands performing at that festival (just a few songs, 13m in total): 
Slave Republic 
01. Number Three 
SONO 
01. All Those City Lights 
02. What You Do 

Due to the limitations of camera, picture turns black for around a second between songs. 

This recording is also available on YouTube - just look for my channel, I have the same username there (parafinSpobs).

Original HD footage: http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6785634
Note that this version includes a pause before encore plus group leaving the stage at the end of the show (that's why it's 2 minutes longer) and features full uninterrupted (and lossless) audio.
